entry.title: time we danced with the truth
entry.summary:
Author: inbetweenthestacks

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 629Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck fidgets, still not looking at him. “It’s stupid,” he says finally. “Yeah, probably, but it’s bothering you, so say it anyway.” “It’s just—“ he cuts himself off. Eddie’s frustration grows. “Just what, Buck?” “I thought I was different!”

entry.title: Off the Record
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,948Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 16

Summary: As the guys started heading back onto the field, Eddie lagged behind. Part of him wanted to head back out. Throw a few more. Work on his accuracy. But, Coach had said to ice his shoulder, and he followed rules to the letter…at least on the field. When he rounded the corner toward the small athletic training room, the cool air from inside hit him like a wave…and there he was. Evan Buckley, officially part of the athletic training staff, unofficially Eddie Diaz’s favorite member of the training staff. Buck was a Sophomore, one of the student trainers assigned to baseball. He’d said something once about studying sports medicine, wanting to work with pro athletes someday. He didn’t act intimidated by the players like some of the other trainers did…didn’t treat Eddie like some kind of celebrity. It was…refreshing. Eddie hadn’t meant to notice him every time he came in…honestly, he tried not to…but something about the way Buck moved, calm and confident, made it hard to look away. Or, Eddie Díaz has the perfect life laid out for him: star pitcher, bright future, endless expectations. Off the field, though, it starts to crack when he’s drawn to Buck…the one person who refuses to play along.

entry.title: Something Just Like This
entry.summary:
Author: penpen_xo

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,694Chapters: 4/10Kudos: 14

Summary: “We have a vacancy, Buck,” Eddie shook his head. “And she’s really nice.” “Maybe that’s the problem!” Buck shot back, an awful bite to his tone that he hated himself for immediately. Buck shuddered slightly as he felt Eddie's hand slip into his and give it a squeeze. “Talk to me Buck.” He pleaded. “It’s stupid.” Buck mumbled. “It isn’t if it’s bothering you this much, you’re almost acting like-” Eddie prompted, realisation setting in all of a sudden, his eyes softening completely as he understood. “You’re scared?”   or   The 118 gain a new Probie and Buck is anything but pleased, determined more than ever to keep them at arms length. He just got Eddie and Christopher back in his life and life at the 118 is finally starting to settle, and he just can't handle any more changes. What he doesn't realise is that he and probationary firefighter Rosie Bishop actually have an awful lot in common.   A different Season 9 story. Buddie + firefam feels, as the team heals and learns to open their hearts again, helping a young girl find her place in a very lonely world along the way.

entry.title: Dancing 'round the kitchen in the refrigirator lights
entry.summary:
Author: propertyofeddiediass

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,912Chapters: 3/4Kudos: 38

Summary: “Buck,” his son says with that sassy tone that Eddie knows to be scared of, “did you know that my dad used to do Ballroom Dancing when he was my age?” Oh my God. How did he find that out?! “HE WHAT? Eddie, you did what?!” His best friend asks as if this is the most incredible piece of information that he has ever received. “Yeah! Grandma told me so one day.” He said, like the smirky little kid he is. That’s it. Eddie’s gonna kill his mother. “Really?” Buck asks, still amused, and Eddie can tell that’s gonna be a long conversation. ... OR: there are 3 undeniable truths about Eddie. He was a ballroom dancer, he's gay, and he's in love with his best friend. But Buck doesn't know any of them. What happens when he finds them out?

entry.title: [Podfic] sounds like forever by saryasy
entry.summary:
Author: Minalover

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 0Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Podfic for sounds like forever by saryasy "No, he doesn't remember falling. He just remembers looking at his best friend one evening, cooping up a sleeping Christopher into his arms, murmuring ‘I got this’ to a half-asleep Eddie who'd made to carry his own son instead. He'd watched as Buck walked quiet but confident steps to Christopher's room, depositing him in bed with a whispered ‘goodnight’, and thought, in his sleepy haze, I love him. The thought didn't startle him. It didn't jolt him awake or turn his world upside down - it wasn't the first time he'd thought it after all. It was, however, the first time he'd wondered whether it was really still platonic, if ever at all. He found he didn't care anyway."

entry.title: Columba
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 152,641Chapters: 27/28Kudos: 239

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth. “You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.” “I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe. “I think I met my daughter tonight.”   or; A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

entry.title: Infant & Innocent
entry.summary:
Author: writingfanfics

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,296Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 9

Summary: It’s post lightning strike and Buck does something stupid, like always. But this time it costs the team something. ——————— “Are you serious, Buckley?” Chimney muttered into his radio, the annoyance evident in his tone. “Again?” Eddie said, in the same annoyed tone. “Where are you, Buckley?” Cap asked, his only dripping with concern rather than the annoyance he would later show Buck when he scolded him for being reckless and endangering himself again. Buck didn’t answer. Buck couldn’t answer. —————— Enjoy :)

entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,035Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Evan Buckley was truly fucked. One week after leaving the only home he’d ever known—his parents’ house—Ground Zero hit, and the world went to hell. Eight months later, he’s still searching for his sister Maddie in Los Angeles, armed only with a tear-stained note: “I’m leaving Doug. I’m going to Los Angeles.”When Buck finally tracks her to Safe Zone 118, he realizes that maybe having a family—and surviving alongside people who actually care—isn’t so bad.At 118, firefighter Eddie Diaz, a single dad, turned his fire station into a refuge with his team when Ground Zero struck. Just trying to keep his kids safe, he’s thrown for a loop when a stranger shows up claiming to be Maddie’s brother. Buck is skilled, prepared, and oddly magnetic—forcing Eddie to question everything he thought he knew about survival, trust, and maybe even… something more.

entry.title: Serendipity
entry.summary:
Author: bluegreen_118

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,419Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 217

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley and his older sister Maddie were adopted by firefighter captain Bobby Nash and his retired cop wife Athena Grant. Buck grew up hard of hearing as long as he could remember. To communicate he speaks and uses American Sign Language, and his sister is completely deaf she only uses American Sign Language.*Eddie Diaz grew up in Texas but when he gets in a car wreck his wife passes away and their five year old son loses his hearing. Eddie found a school for the deaf in Los Angeles. With that he packs their bags and moves to LA.*What happens when two walks of life meet?

entry.title: If we're just friends, Then we're bad ones
entry.summary:
Author: Baileyloves911

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 51,204Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 70

Summary: The woman followed her gaze only to catch Eddie staring at Buck with his jaw slack completely distracted by the way Buck’s shoulders flexed under his gear as he leaned into the kitchen. Eddie blinked too late while yanking his eyes away with his cheeks heating. The old woman’s eyes widened knowingly. She whispered again softer this time. “Ohhh. Are they a couple? Because if not…” she gasped. “..that boy is so in love with him.” Hen slapped a hand over her mouth with her shoulders shaking with laughter. “What?” Eddie frowned with his cheeks coloring. “What’s so funny?” “Nothing” Hen croaked while trying not to lose it. Buck straightened while holding up the scorched microwave tray like it was a trophy.

On the two year anniversary of the serial murders that culminated in a bloody fight with two dead bodies and a whole host of traumatized party-goers. Athena finds herself at the center of a developing nightmare that will force her to use every last whit and skill she has at her disposal. Maddie reeling still from the events of two years ago, takes action rallying herself and May to find the ones who have donned the Ghostface mask.
